page.title: 07THE PUBLIC IN MICHELMERSH
page.content: Four of the fourth year went to {Michelmersh}to interview the public. They interviewed four people. The pupils discovered a wall behind which was the old waterworks which was demolished in 1982. They interviewed a man who used to work in the waterworks who now lives in what was a tied cottage. A tied cottage is a cottage that goes with a job. On the tied cottage is a plaque on which was inscribed S.H.W.W.Co. which means South Hants Water Works Company. Villagers feel that considerable areas of the old-type countryside have been destroyed by the extractive industries, and not as yet matched by subsequent restoration. Out of the four people interviewed most of them noticed there were more houses being built. Two relied on the local bus service.
